title: When Book is the same as Regular in InD CS
content:
I am building a CFF/OpenType family for a client that insists that two of the weights of the multi-weight family be named Book and Regular. I have always avoided having both of these names in the same family.   
   
The fonts work correctly in Illustrator CS (both Mac and PC) but in InDesign CS whenever Regular is selected it immediately changes to Book. This happens both on Mac and PC.   
   
Anyone else have this experience.
author: terminaldesign

comments.content:
If you change Book to something slightly different   
does it do the same thing? Say, Booken or something?   
My guess would be that ID thinks of Book and Regular   
as the same thing.   
   
Maybe related, recently I've found that ID CS needs   
to be restarted to show recently renamed OT fonts.   
I've been testing a big batch of OT fonts lately and   
been haunted by this.

As a follow up, I was able to rename one   
of my fonts Book and recreate the problem   
described. Is this the end of Book?
Would it work to change the name "Book" to "Text"?

Yes, everything works fine when Book is changed to Text.   
   
But the client still prefers Book and Regular.

James,   
   
can you build a OpenType TT (.ttf) version of the family and tell us if the problem persists? Also, what are you using to build the fonts?   
   
Adam

So, this bug has been verified by the InDesign team and I have the bug number. It was actually present in InDesign 1.0, fixed in 1.5, still okay in 2.0, and then somehow broken again in CS. Our apologies. We will make it right....   
   
T
